info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 10:59PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Rock Island, northwestern Mercer, northwestern Louisa, southeastern Johnson, northeastern Washington and western Muscatine Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1058 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Conesville, or 8 miles northwest of Columbus Junction, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Columbus Junction and Lone Tree around 1110 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Conesville, Nichols, Letts and Fruitland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
